notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh Containers for 2.5.8

This update has a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh is Red Hat's distribution of the Istio service mesh project, tailored for installation into an OpenShift Container Platform installation.

Security Fix(es):

* kiali-ossmc-container: path-to-regexp Unpatched `path-to-regexp` ReDoS in 0.1.x (CVE-2024-52798)
* openshift-istio-kiali-rhel8-container: path-to-regexp Unpatched `path-to-regexp` ReDoS in 0.1.x (CVE-2024-52798)
* kiali-ossmc-container: nanoid mishandles non-integer values (CVE-2024-55565)
* openshift-istio-kiali-rhel8-container: nanoid mishandles non-integer values (CVE-2024-55565)
* openshift-istio-kiali-rhel8-container: Non-linear parsing of case-insensitive content in golang.org/x/net/html (CVE-2024-45338)
* openshift-istio-proxyv2-rhel8-container: Non-linear parsing of case-insensitive content in golang.org/x/net/html (CVE-2024-45338)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang.org/x/net/html. This flaw allows an attacker to craft input to the parse functions that would be processed non-linearly with respect to its length, resulting in extremely slow parsing. This issue can cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang.org/x/net/html: Non-linear parsing of case-insensitive content in golang.org/x/net/html
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is rated as an Important severity because an attacker can craft malicious input that causes the parsing functions to process data non-linearly, resulting in significant delays which leads to a denial of service by exhausting system resources.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang.org/x/net/html: Non-linear parsing of case-insensitive content in golang.org/x/net/html

notes.text: A flaw was found in path-to-regexp. A path-to-regexp turns path strings into regular expressions. In certain cases, path-to-regexp will output a regular expression that can be exploited to cause poor performance.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: This vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2024-45296.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Avoid using two parameters within a single path segment when the separator is not, for example, /:a-:b. Alternatively, you can define the regex used for both parameters and ensure they do not overlap to allow backtracking.

cwe.name: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

notes.text: nanoid (aka Nano ID) before 5.0.9 mishandles non-integer values. 3.3.8 is also a fixed version.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
